parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Orders the unit(s) to watch the given position or target (via the radio). Use [[objNull]] as the target to order a unit to stop watching a position/target.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> units [[commandWatch]] position

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> units: [[Object]] or [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> position: [[Array]] - format [[Position]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> units [[commandWatch]] target

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> units: [[Object]] or [[Array]]

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> target: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldierOne [[commandWatch]] [[markerPos]] "MarkerMoveOne";</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[s1, s2] [[commandWatch]] [[player]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>mp</name>=<value> This command is only effective when used on local units. When used on a remote unit, this command will create radio dialogue on the machine the unit is local to, but the unit will not watch the target object/position.

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[doWatch]], [[lookAt]], [[glanceAt]]
</value></part></template>
